title: Gears 6 art direction is inspired by The Handmaid’s Tale
text:
Gears 5 – the next game may look very different

The first whispers about the next Gears Of War have covered a surprising subject: the fact that the game will be influenced by a TV show.

Microsoft hasn’t announced Gears 6 yet but even if Gears 5 didn’t end with most of its story unresolved it’s obvious that there’s going to be another one. After all, developer The Coalition was reorganised to work on nothing but Gears Of War games.

Gears 6 will presumably be a Project Scarlett game though, so you wouldn’t necessarily expect to hear anything about it yet. But art director Aryan Hanbeck has offered an interesting tease of what the next game might look like.

Interviewed on Iranian podcast Wassup Conversations, as spotted by IGN Australia, Hanbeck stated that a major visual influence is TV show The Handmaid’s Tale.

‘One thing – the guys here will probably laugh if they see this – but I’ve been telling all the artists non-stop to go watch Handmaid’s Tale… The composition, the colour, and just the cinematography and symbolism is just off the charts,’ said Hanbeck.

‘So, I watched that and I’m like, ‘Wow we gotta find a way to get more of this stuff in Gears 6.’

Gears 5 already departed somewhat from Gears Of War’s famously brown colour scheme, with a wider use of colour and some different architectural styles.

The Handmaid’s Tale though makes heavy use of colour coding for different types of characters as well as sporting a very stark style of cinematography, with very precise framing and minimalist, natural lighting.

Despite the colour-coding of outfits the colours for the rest of the show are usually very subdued, creating an almost dreamlike quality – which is presumably what Hanbeck is interested in.

He also mentions that, as many guessed, Destiny 2 was an influence for the look of Gears 5, so a serious TV show known for its excellent cinematography is quite a switch.

The other reason The Handmaid’s Tale is a surprising choice is that Gears Of War’s lore involves some very dubious elements that are rarely mentioned in the games but do come up in the novels.

The most notorious is the Birthing Creche programme of ‘breeding farms’, used to repopulate the planet after the initial Locust invasion.

Whether Gears 6 will address this aspect of the lore or if the influence from The Handmaid’s Tale is purely visual remains to be seen, but it’s certainly an interesting choice.
